alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:36PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Livingston and northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 800 PM CDT... At 735 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brownfields, or near Baker. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Watson, Brownfields, Greenwell Spring, Merrydale and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes Interstate 110 in Louisiana near mile marker 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
